summary.body: 0620 on a Sunday morning is -not- the time to be racing cars around a residential building! Is anyone else awake? People have been driving up and down the tunnel at at least 60mph in clusters; some with modified exhaust pipes that make them sound like mopeds. After twenty minutes or so, the circuit seemed to be extended to include Aldersgate as well. I tried COL police non-emergency number, but no answer. It just rings and rings. I'm not even sure; is there actually any law broken if they drive around in circles in a residential area? Other than speeding, I mean. It's happened before quite a few times.  I felt rather pleased a few months ago when one of them, whilst speeding outrageously through the tunnel, burst a tyre on the kerb. No damage done except for the tyre; it seemed like just deserts so I allowed myself a small smile. Sadly, there was no such luck today. I wouldn't mind terribly much if they did it during the day, but it's only ever between 0100 and 0730 in the morning. Which is rather antisocial. I want to go back to sleep and when I started writing this message after an hour it seemed to have calmed down, but they are back again now. 0620 to 0715 so far.
summary.subject: Tunnel-racing

summary.body: I rent a parking space on level 01 of Willoughby and in the past 6 months I have found a screw(same type of screw on both occassions) embedded in one of my tyres. I am sure that nobody who lives in the Barbican would be responsible for this, however for it to happen once is an incovenience but twice begins to make me feel a little suspicious. Has anyone else who rents a space in a Barbican car park faced a similar problem?
summary.subject: Parking problems
